alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 6:41AM CDT until June 22 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In west central Kansas, Greeley and Wallace. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional storms are developing southeast Colorado and moving northeast into areas that have seen heavy rainfall overnight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
